page.title: 17East Leys Farm, Grindale.
page.content: This farm is run jointly with another at Flamborough by two brothers. It has 358 acres of land. There are 80 acres of winter wheat, 40 acres of peas, 67 acres of Spring barley, 58 acres of sugar beet and 98 acres of winter barley. There are 6 acres of paddocks for ponies and 2 acres of woodland to provide shelter for the house. The farm-house was built in 1874 of brick. It was extended and made into two houses in 1911. Two workmen are employed on the farm. The farm has 3 International tractors, 2 David Brown Rowcrop tractors for sugar beet, 1 Claas combine, 2 balers and 1 fork lift. 16 Holstein calves are kept which are to join the dairy herd at Flamborough.
